Section.Paragraph: This paper sketches some basic features of the SYNPHONICS account of the computational modelling of incremental language production with the example of the generation of passive sentences. The SYNPHONICS approach aims at linking psycholinguistic insights into the nature of the human natural language production process with well-established assumptions in theoretical and computational linguistics concerning the representation and processing of grammatical knowledge. We differentiate between two possible kinds of stimuli within the generation process that trigger the formation of passive sentences: a Formulator-external stimulus and a Formulator-internal one. The Formulator-external stimulus is determined by the conceptual/contextual condition of agent backgrounding: An agentless semantic representation is verbalized by way of constructing an ergativized verbal complex in the morphological structure-building component, rather than by mapping the semantic representation directly onto a passive lemma.
